intro: Telanthera arenaria, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Telanthera arenaria is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and attractive floral display.
